page.title: 09Agriculture in the area.
page.content: Most of the land around the South Andover area is used for intensive crop farming. Wheat and barley are the main crops, but they also grow peas, beans and rape in large quantities. Most farmers use fertilisers such as nitrogen but most are trying to cut down on this. The crops are also sprayed with insecticides, fungicides and herbicides to prevent weeds, fungi and insects destroying the crop. Many different types of machinery are used on the farms including tractors, ploughs, seed-drills, harrows, sprayers, bailers, combine harvesters and fork-lift trucks. The farm workers rely on the machines for most of the jobs on the farm. As well as crops, most farms in the area keep some cattle. Most keep dairy cattle, but some use their poorer lands for beef cattle.
